page.title: 19Children in Oakley 3
page.content: {Marbles}is a popular game with the children. They play in pairs. Each child in turn rolls his marble and tries to hit that of his fellow. The first to succeed wins both marbles. {Special vocabulary}describes the{size of marbles. From small upwards: Cat's eye,Glassy (normal),American dub,Dub, Queensize, Kingsize, Double kingsize, Triple king, Dragon. Examples of the names given to{colours}are: red knight for an opaque red marble, etc.,solid or china for a marble of pot or china, pearl for oily transparent, guinea for black knight with lines, squid - with lines that squiggle, Mrs.Thatcher's eggy - plain solid with white dots. Lemonade, coloured cola and Ribena (the names of drinks) for coloured glass with bubbles in, misty and smoky for glass with cloudy colour, moony for a black knight with speckles.
